title: Quiz 6: Health History & Diagnosis
description: Test your ability to take a comprehensive health history and understand clinical diagnosis principles.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ complaint is the specific issue that brings the patient to seek medical help.
questions.explanation: The Chief Complaint (CC) is the primary reason for the visit.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of the 'History of Present Illness' (HPI)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: HPI details the current problem (Onset, Course, Severity, Factors). Family history and Bio data are separate sections.

questions.question: What does IMAI stand for?

options.text: Integrated Management of Adolescent and Adult Illness

questions.explanation: IMAI stands for Integrated Management of Adolescent and Adult Illness, a strategy similar to IMCI but for older age groups.

questions.question: When taking a health history, you should avoid open-ended questions like 'Tell me about it' to save time.
questions.explanation: Open-ended questions are encouraged to allow the patient to express facts and feelings spontaneously.

questions.question: Match the history section with the information collected:

pairs.right: Inventory of symptoms by body organ

questions.explanation: Bio data = Identify; Past = History; Family = Genetics/Env; ROS = Head-to-toe check.

questions.question: In which situation might the patient NOT be the primary informant?

options.text: A patient with a broken leg

questions.explanation: Patients who are children, unconscious, or mentally incapacitated (dementia/psychiatric) may require a surrogate informant.

questions.question: To arrive at a clinical diagnosis, you match the patient's complaints and examination findings with known disease patterns.
questions.explanation: Clinical diagnosis involves synthesizing history, exam findings, and investigations to identify the condition.

questions.question: What is the term for a symptom that occurs simultaneously with the chief complaint?
questions.explanation: Associated manifestations/symptoms accompany the main problem (e.g., sweating with chest pain).

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an open-ended question?
questions.explanation: 'How does it feel?' requires a descriptive answer, whereas the others can be answered with Yes/No.
questions.hint: Cannot be answered with Yes or No.

questions.question: IMAI interventions include which of the following? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: IMAI covers Acute, Chronic, and Palliative care for adults/adolescents. Neonatal care is under IMCI/Neonatal protocols.
